title: Portfolio Website Kickoff
details: Created Conda Environment, set up Flask, initialized Git repo, planned website sections.

title: Basic Routing & Templates
details: Created Flask routes and Jinja template. Did Navbar section and created requirements.txt as well as testing app.py and pushing to Origin

title: Not the Start I wanted
details: Spent an hour troubleshooting why my css colors weren't updating. Figured out I had darkmode on and turned it off. Centered some divs for confidence building after that

title: Collecting Assets, setting up layout
details: downloaded company logos. Tried 3 JavaScript/CSS methods before deciding on final animations and transitions for sections.

title: Working on Experience Carousel and card
details: Built carousel for company logos. Built job card templates.

title: 1 Section Down, 6 to go!
details: Finished job cards. Tweaked and fixed some animation stuff. Added contact stuff to site footer

title: Education section
details: Re-used the same cards from the experience section but made them into accordions.

title: Skills section
details: Use the accordion elements I made yesterday to make 4 skills containers. Hmmm, what skills are important is an important question but I want to categorize these correctly. Made my brain into a png.

title: Skills section... finished
details: Took a long, deep look into industry specific skills and what I best have. Switched around accordions, added Skill-Pills.

title: Made the timeline section
details: Made a simple timeline that shows site progress.

title: Plan out site analytics
details: Reading up and comparing IP2location, GeoIP, Echarts and planning what needs to be done for this side-quest.

title: Refactoring
details: Refactored single html page into multiple section tempates to make things a bit easier to seperate.

title: Site analytics and database
details: Set up SQLAlchemy and test/integrate viewer data

title: Site analytics and database continued
details: Spent full day on this task but struggling with mapping. Dropping this idea for now so I can get back on track.

title: Lexicon section
details: Set up Lexicon Section with javascript and json

title: Populate lexicon
details: Put about 100 important words into my lexicon

title: Tech Stack section
details: Set up tech stack section. As this is one of the last sections, I'm just using elements I've created from previous sections. No need to reinvent the wheel.

title: Finish Tech Stack Section
details: Summarised stack into 9 cards. Got logo icons and added those

title: What are my interests?
details: Broke down my interests into 4 categories. It's going to be similar to the skills accordion.

title: Clean Up Time!
details: Went through all 7 sections to see that everything is working. Fixed Nav bar title & tool-tips. Also redid IP2loc so that it just does an API call instead of needing to store the bins locally.

title: Colors and proof reading
details: Weather outside today is cold and rainy... perfect weather for practical color science

title: Freeze dependencies and deploy!
details: Following cold and rainy theme, I'm freezing my deeps and putting this up!

title: Deploy!
details: Fighting to get website up. It's up! Definitely need to fix lots of stuff.

title: Deployment Feedback and fixes planning.
details: Majority of viewers were on mobile and no mobile view. Research mobile UI tips and fixing. Get mobile friendly view up by weekend (maybe 5 hours work?)

title: Desktop First and Responsive Design
details: I have 1,600 lines of CSS rules that I need to refactor and simplify, and while doing this I'm also going to work on the mobile view.

title: Desktop First and Responsive Design Continued
details: Refactored around 1,000 lines of CSS and can probably finish this next time I work on it.

title: Responsive Design Continued
details: A lot of manually fixing the CSS line by line and adding to a MASSIVE media query at the bottom of the script.

title: Finish CSS, Merge, Redeploy!
details: Finally finished CSS. Push to Github. Redeploy. Mobile Friendly DONE

title: 502 Bad Gateway: Production Server Down
details: Well, umm.... The GOOD news is that I've been getting lots of traffic to my side. The BAD news is that I've run out of free hosting credits. This entire project so far has cost me $0, and my budget to fix this is still $0.
